reviews.review: This movie is on par with the first one though not perfect. Just a few nitpicks that are enough to knock off that one star.
I'm scared that's what children are watching nowadays. It's evil. My nephews love it, but I think it's more harm than good - particularly to my ears afterwards.
Its fine a little but forgettable though

This movie's strengths are the mythology it clearly wanted to expand upon while what brought it to a screeching halt most of the time was it being a full on musical. While some songs where good, it felt like they were trying to hit another bullseye like they did with "Let it Go". 

Despite the songs taking over the film, I liked this sequel and hope that if there ever is a third film; they can figure out how to make another good story accompanied with just the right amount of songs. The score on the other hand, was something I enjoyed too.

Ok, far weaker than Frozen I but the songs are so captivating.  The plot is mild and dull, I was really expecting a villain for the sisters to face against and in the end they split up, Elsa essentially became what Anna was and in order to free her, Anna has to break a dam, literally the dam is the villain of this movie.  I would say Grandfather since he built it, but he passed away a longgggggg time ago so literally the wall was the issue.  So like if the wall was the issue this whole time, why didn't the spirit call and sing to her more regularly, why wait until shes in control of her magic?  Bit too convenient.  Also, when you have things to lose or you sacrifice something for the greater good, that sends a message that everything has a cost.  Their kingdoms cost was the dam, but now that its destroyed, the kingdom should have been destroyed and they can always rebuild, but nope, Elsa swoops in and saves the kingdom like wtf LOL
A great musical video with very poor plot.

Frozen 2 was a spectacular adventurous and thrilling sequel to the hit 2013 Oscar winning blockbuster!  Had so much action suspense heart and more and the new songs are amazing! Olaf crushed it as well! Definite recommend to all!
Great way to continue from the first. My daughters loved it alot.
ehhhhhh it's fine. it has its moments. it's a VERY unearned movie. lots of things that I was like sure that'd be dope if there had been any build up to that whatsoever
